summary: Build a new children's learning game.
imageRequirements:
## Required Images
- Friendly cartoon mascot (smiling bear) on transparent background (mascot-bear.dim_512x512.png)
- Soft playful background with warm pastel shapes (no text) (bg-playroom.dim_1920x1080.png)
- Flat rounded icon for Letters category (icon-letters.dim_256x256.png)
- Flat rounded icon for Numbers category (icon-numbers.dim_256x256.png)
- Flat rounded icon for Colors category (icon-colors.dim_256x256.png)

existing_features.title: Create a kid-friendly home screen for a new children's learning game that lets the player choose a learning category (at minimum: Letters, Numbers, Colors) and start a game session.

Implement the core learning game loop: show one question at a time with 3–4 large multiple-choice answers, provide immediate feedback (correct/incorrect), and advance through a short round (e.g., 10 questions) with an end-of-round summary.

Provide a built-in question bank for the minimum categories (Letters, Numbers, Colors) with age-appropriate prompts and answers, and ensure the game can randomly select questions without repeats within a round when possible.

Add progress tracking so a player’s best score and total rounds played are saved per category and can be displayed on the home screen (or a simple 'Progress' view). Persist progress on the backend keyed by the user principal when available.

Apply a cohesive, playful visual theme appropriate for young children (warm, bright palette; rounded shapes; large typography; clear spacing) and enforce it consistently across all screens without using a blue/purple primary palette.
Add required generated static images (mascot, background, category icons) to the frontend and render them from the static assets directory (frontend/public/assets/generated) in the UI.
